intro: Thesium flexuosum, commonly known as the slender thesium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically borne on short, hairy stalks. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slightly hairy surface. Thesium flexuosum is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal or heathland environments.
